of artistic pleas- ure. 
But when Katie brought the required dress, Princess Mary remained sitting motionless be- fore the glass, looking at her face, and saw in the mirror her eyes full of tears and her mouth quivering, ready to burst into sobs. 
"Come, dear princess," said Mademoiselle Bourienne, "just one more little effort." 
The little princess, taking the dress from the maid, came up to Princess Mary. 
"Well, now we'll arrange something quite simple and becoming," she said.
